title: Hiroshima - Peace Park + Museum
content:
Once we were back on the mainland from Miyajima, we headed into Hiroshima proper to visit the Peace Park, A-Bomb dome, and museum.

Hiroshima is a lovely city, and even more so with the coloured leaves everywhere. We heard a bit of information from our guide, which was interesting getting a local's perspective on the history and culture surrounding it.

Obviously the memorials and experiences are sombre here, with the museum being the strongest hitting of all. It is overwhelming to see and read about, despite having seen it in the past.

After we had made our way through the museum, we had a little time to grab a drink and snack before we were on our way.

Dinner tonight was okonomiyaki finally - everyone enjoyed it, and it was good to check it off the list!

Unfortunately our hotel was a huge drive away as it had been changed from our original itinerary. This meant we arrived late and the whole tour group was in a pretty poor mood having not known what or why it was taking so long. Was a shame to put a bit of a downer on the trip at that point.
